comments:

text file (the only file changed) to CVS, but nothing happens reaction. Log shows:

After restarting Eclipse the commit went smoothly.

I did some quick profiling. Opening the Commit coment dialog uses up 7 MB. 
This seems a bit excessive but doesn't seem to be unique to this dialog. 
Opening the properties dialog uses 5 MB. This is somehting we should look at 
during the performance pass. However, it does not appear that the commit 
itself was the cause of the OutOfMemory problem.

Yes, I don't think the normal opening of the dialogs would cause that exception.
I rather sounds like a race condition to me that causes a lot of memory to be
allocated, like in an infinite loop or a leaking thread. Because as I said,
after restarting Eclipse I could perform the commit.

Adding my name to the cc list as we are now tracking performance issues more
closely. Please remove the performance keyword if this is not a performance bug.
Opening a commit dialog in 3.1 does not use up excessive amounts of memory
